text: Welcome, <@U01NJ39M36K>! If I lived where you live, I wouldn't go a day without a salt bagel from Scratch Baking in Willard Square!

elements.text: Welcome,
! If I lived where you live, I wouldn't go a day without a salt bagel from Scratch Baking in Willard Square!

text: Thanks, all! Maine is a pretty special place. <@U01P8JJP5GC>, I have a cache of salt bagels in my freezer for those days when I just can't make it over the bridge. Scratch is one of the best places, owned by some of the best humans, on earth. <@U015B88C4CA>, that is a great question! Years ago I wrote a piece about Sam Haywardm one of the trailblazers of the farm to table movement here in Maine; it traced his influence in and out of state. That piece isn't online, but <https://downeast.com/food-drink/sam-hayward-ripple-effect/|here> is a short appreciation of him.

text: Oooh thank you for that link, <@U01NJ39M36K>! I was finally able to visit Portland last winter (right before COVID) but didn’t get to visit many of the restaurants. I look forward to heading back hopefully this summer and supporting the local scene, as it’s a short jaunt from Greater Boston.

Looking forwarded to connecting with you all! I’m also on Twitter at @ksquinn4 :blush:

text: Hi everyone! I´m Maribel Muñoz. I worked at Google as a Google Ads Account Strategist for 8 years, designing campaigns and writing advertising copy among other functions. Before that I worked in a bilingual advertising agency in Arizona. While at Google I also worked on many content related projects (I wrote content for the EMEA AdWords blog, as well as case studies, webinars etc.). I have a strong background in languages: I majored in English literature and linguistics from Cordoba University in Spain, got a Masters in Spanish from Ohio University and studied a Ph.D. in Hispanic studies at Penn State University. I have been a freelance copywriter and translator for the past 2 years. I am looking for freelance content jobs in English or Spanish, so if you are in need please get in touch with me. Greetings from Madrid!

text: Hey all, Kevon here. I love content because of its educational value. Good content can help so so many people! I’m the author of <https://kevoncheung.com/building-in-public?utm_campaign=superpath&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=slack|the #BuildingInPublic guide>, helping people use transparency in their content to win. Looking forward to be here to help each other out :slightly_smiling_face:
